node.title: NZ Warriors upgrade Taylor to full-time contract for 2022 NRL season
node.description: The 26-year-old had previously been on a train and trial deal with the club.
node.content: ["NZ Warriors have completed the signing of half Ash Taylor before the 2022 NRL season, upgrading him from a train and trial contract.", "Taylor, 26, linked up with the Warriors following the 2021 season after leaving Gold Coast Titans as a free agent.", "And after a spell with the Kiwi club in their Australian-based pre-season, Taylor has inked a one-year contract with the Warriors.", "Taylor's arrival sees him join the returning Shaun Johnson as well as Chanel Harris-Tavita and utility Kodi Nikorima as options in the halves for the Warriors in 2022.", "\"We're excited to confirm Ash is staying with us,\" Warriors general manager of football Craig Hodges says.", "\"He has been a great addition since joining the club and has more than met our expectations. He has added so much with his training ethic, enthusiasm and his all-round contribution.\"", "Club captain Tohu Harris welcomes Taylor's signing.", "\"Ash has fitted in well with our group and we're really enjoying having him around,\" he says. \"He has given us an experienced voice and has added to the competition in our halves.\"", "The Warriors are Taylor's third NRL club after stints with both Brisbane Broncos and the Titans."]
